decks.notes: This deck is focused on aggressive play using Spirit creatures. The key strategy is to use the synergy between the spirits to quickly and efficiently control the board and damage the opponent. The deck includes powerful spirit creatures like Drogskol Captain, Mausoleum Wanderer, and Supreme Phantom, which provide various benefits and buffs to the overall spirit team. Key cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Path to Exile offer control and removal options. The deck also includes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and ensure a quick and steady stream of threats.

The main focus of this deck is to take advantage of +1/+1 counters through cards like Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Walking Ballista, alongside Hardened Scales to further boost the counters. The deck also includes various ways to generate additional tokens and manipulate +1/+1 counters, such as Animation Module and Steel Overseer. With a combination of efficient creatures and artifacts, this Aggro-Hardened Scales deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with powerful synergies and an aggressive playstyle.

The deck revolves around slowing down the opponent's game plan and disrupting their resources. It achieves this through various artifacts and control elements, such as Chalice of the Void, Ensnaring Bridge, and Sorcerous Spyglass. The deck also utilizes search and tutoring effects like Whir of Invention and Mishra's Bauble to ensure consistency and find the necessary pieces. Additionally, the deck has some graveyard hate with Tormod's Crypt and can recurr valuable artifacts with Crucible of Worlds and Academy Ruins. Overall, the focus is on control and resource denial, with a strong emphasis on artifacts for synergy and utility.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces, such as Allosaurus Rider and Nourishing Shoal, to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Laboratory Maniac onto the battlefield. Utilizing cards like Neoform, Eldritch Evolution, and Chancellor of the Tangle to enable fast and explosive plays, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and win the game through a combination of fast mana acceleration and creature synergy. Additionally, the deck includes protection and filtering cards to help achieve its combo as efficiently as possible.

This control deck focuses on card advantage and disruption through spells like Spellstutter Sprite and Narset, Parter of Veils. Utilizing efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Mantis Rider, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, the deck aims to control the board while also dealing damage. The mana base is built around snow lands and various fetch lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by countering and removing threats while maintaining a steady stream of card advantage and pressure.

The deck focuses on quickly getting high-cost creatures into play using Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach, along with Faithless Looting and Discovery / Dispersal to dig for combo pieces. Creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm provide powerful threats and win conditions, while Simian Spirit Guide and Desperate Ritual help accelerate the deck's game plan. Nourishing Shoal and Manamorphose provide additional ways to combo off and generate value. The deck aims to disrupt opponents and quickly reanimate big creatures for explosive plays and overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer with disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining pressure on the board. The deck also features utility cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable to provide additional versatility and threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly gain life through cards like Martyr of Sands and Serra Ascendant, while controlling the board with cards like Wrath of God and Ghostly Prison. The deck also utilizes cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Squadron Hawk to search for key pieces. Crucible of Worlds ensures land recursion, while Emeria, the Sky Ruin provides late-game value. Flagstones of Trokair and Ghost Quarter help with land destruction and synergy with cards like Brought Back. Overall, the deck focuses on gaining life, controlling the board, and out-valuing the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Bedlam Reveler and Seasoned Pyromancer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Lingering Souls provides constant threats and Kaya's Guile offers versatility. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt help control the board, while Angrath's Rampage and Kolaghan's Command provide additional disruption. The deck also has a mana denial strategy with Blood Moon, and a consistent mana base with fetchlands. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, removal, and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive threats in the form of Arclight Phoenix and Thing in the Ice while using efficient card draw and manipulation spells like Faithless Looting, Serum Visions, and Sleight of Hand to maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws. The deck also includes a suite of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Surgical Extraction allows for disruptive plays and graveyard hate, while Pyromancer Ascension provides additional value and potential for explosive turns. The mana base is built to ensure consistent access to all colors while minimizing potential drawbacks.

The archetype of this deck is focused on using a combination of control spells and a diverse range of multicolor cards, particularly Niv-Mizzet Reborn, to gain card advantage and control the game. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, planeswalkers, and versatile creatures to outvalue opponents and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing its flexibility and ability to answer a wide range of threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through superior card advantage and board control.

The main concept of this deck is to fill up the graveyard quickly with cards like Glimpse the Unthinkable and Stitcher's Supplier. This enables you to bring back powerful creatures like Vengevine, Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, and Bloodghast from the graveyard onto the battlefield. Additionally, Creeping Chill provides additional damage and lifegain when milled into the graveyard. With the right combination of cards, this deck can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a powerful board presence and aggressive attacks.

This deck utilizes a combination of cascade spells and Living End to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and then bring them back to the battlefield for a powerful and explosive combo finish. It focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and card draw until it can cast Living End and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The mana base is streamlined to ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells and set up the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and card advantage, while controlling the game with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Whir of Invention. The deck aims to assemble the Thopter-Sword combo using Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to create an army of flying tokens. Urza, Lord High Artificer serves as a powerful mana engine, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control and disruption. The deck utilizes a toolbox approach with cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Pithing Needle to handle various matchups.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Liliana of the Veil, Tarmogoyf, and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building a threatening board presence. The deck also employs a variety of removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and Nihil Spellbomb allows for graveyard hate against popular graveyard-based strategies in the format. Overall, the deck looks to maintain board control and apply pressure to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using Collected Company and Aether Vial to quickly put creatures onto the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes a combination of creatures with enter the battlefield abilities, such as Tidehollow Sculler and Deputy of Detention, as well as value creatures like Eternal Witness and Scavenging Ooze. The deck also takes advantage of synergies between cards like Flickerwisp and Eldrazi Displacer to control the board and generate incremental advantage. The mana base is designed to support the multiple color requirements of the deck while also incorporating powerful lands like Eldrazi Temple and Horizon Canopy.
